user_request: A love poem about eyes meeting across a crowded room.
final_poem:
In the hum of a crowd where voices blend,  
your gaze, a spark in the static noise,  
drew time to a halt, a breathless thread  
woven through the chaos—my heartbeat,  
a drumroll lost in the din.  

A silence bloomed where the world once roamed,  
a bridge of light between two unknowns,  
time folded, and the moment became a hymn  
—a hymn of stars in the eyes of another.  

The pulse of the room faded to a whisper,  
while your glance etched a universe on my skin.  
Now every crowd is a gallery where I find you—  
a portrait of forever, framed in the blink of a glance.
